005package edu.wpi.first.units;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Value;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Acceleration;
010import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle;
011import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularAcceleration;
012import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularMomentum;
013import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularVelocity;
014import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Current;
015import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Dimensionless;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Distance;
017import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Energy;
018import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Force;
019import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Frequency;
020import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearAcceleration;
021import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearMomentum;
022import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearVelocity;
023import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Mass;
024import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.MomentOfInertia;
025import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Mult;
026import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per;
027import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Power;
028import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Resistance;
029import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Temperature;
030import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Time;
031import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Torque;
032import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Velocity;
033import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Voltage;
034
035/**
036 * A measure holds the magnitude and unit of some dimension, such as distance, time, or speed. Two
037 * measures with the same <i>unit</i> and <i>magnitude</i> are effectively equivalent objects.
038 *
039 * @param <U> the unit type of the measure
040 */
041public interface Measure<U extends Unit> extends Comparable<Measure<U>> {
042  /**
043   * The threshold for two measures to be considered equivalent if converted to the same unit. This
044   * is only needed due to floating-point error.
045   */
046  double EQUIVALENCE_THRESHOLD = 1e-12;
047
048  /**
049   * Gets the unitless magnitude of this measure.
050   *
051   * @return the magnitude in terms of {@link #unit() the unit}.
052   */
053  double magnitude();
054
055  /**
056   * Gets the magnitude of this measure in terms of the base unit. If the unit is the base unit for
057   * its system of measure, then the value will be equivalent to {@link #magnitude()}.
058   *
059   * @return the magnitude in terms of the base unit
060   */
061  double baseUnitMagnitude();
062
063  /**
064   * Gets the units of this measure.
065   *
066   * @return the unit
067   */
068  U unit();
069
070  /**
071   * Converts this measure to a measure with a different unit of the same type, eg minutes to
072   * seconds. Converting to the same unit is equivalent to calling {@link #magnitude()}.
073   *
074   * <pre>
075   *   Meters.of(12).in(Feet) // 39.3701
076   *   Seconds.of(15).in(Minutes) // 0.25
077   * </pre>
078   *
079   * @param unit the unit to convert this measure to
080   * @return the value of this measure in the given unit
081   */
082  default double in(U unit) {
083    if (this.unit().equals(unit)) {
084      return magnitude();
085    } else {
086      return unit.fromBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude());
087    }
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * A convenience method to get the base unit of the measurement. Equivalent to {@code
092   * unit().getBaseUnit()}.
093   *
094   * @return the base unit of measure.
095   */
096  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
097  default U baseUnit() {
098    return (U) unit().getBaseUnit();
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Returns an immutable copy of this measure. The copy can be used freely and is guaranteed never
103   * to change.
104   *
105   * @return the copied measure
106   */
107  Measure<U> copy();
108
109  /**
110   * Returns a mutable copy of this measure. It will be initialized to the current state of this
111   * measure, but can be changed over time without needing to allocate new measurement objects.
112   *
113   * @return the copied measure
114   */
115  MutableMeasure<U, ?, ?> mutableCopy();
116
117  /**
118   * Returns a measure equivalent to this one equal to zero minus its current value. For non-linear
119   * unit types like temperature, the zero point is treated as the zero value of the base unit (eg
120   * Kelvin). In effect, this means code like {@code Celsius.of(10).unaryMinus()} returns a value
121   * equivalent to -10 Kelvin, and <i>not</i> -10° Celsius.
122   *
123   * @return a measure equal to zero minus this measure
124   */
125  Measure<U> unaryMinus();
126
127  /**
128   * Adds another measure of the same unit type to this one.
129   *
130   * @param other the measurement to add
131   * @return a measure of the sum of both measures
132   */
133  Measure<U> plus(Measure<? extends U> other);
134
135  /**
136   * Subtracts another measure of the same unit type from this one.
137   *
138   * @param other the measurement to subtract
139   * @return a measure of the difference between the measures
140   */
141  Measure<U> minus(Measure<? extends U> other);
142
143  /**
144   * Multiplies this measure by a scalar unitless multiplier.
145   *
146   * @param multiplier the scalar multiplication factor
147   * @return the scaled result
148   */
149  Measure<U> times(double multiplier);
150
151  /**
152   * Multiplies this measure by a scalar dimensionless multiplier.
153   *
154   * @param multiplier the scalar multiplication factor
155   * @return the scaled result
156   */
157  Measure<U> times(Dimensionless multiplier);
158
159  /**
160   * Generates a new measure that is equal to this measure multiplied by another. Some dimensional
161   * analysis is performed to reduce the units down somewhat; for example, multiplying a {@code
162   * Measure<Time>} by a {@code Measure<Velocity<Distance>>} will return just a {@code
163   * Measure<Distance>} instead of the naive {@code Measure<Mult<Time, Velocity<Distance>>}. This is
164   * not guaranteed to perform perfect dimensional analysis.
165   *
166   * @param multiplier the unit to multiply by
167   * @return the multiplicative unit
168   */
169  default Measure<?> times(Measure<?> multiplier) {
170    final double baseUnitResult = baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude();
171
172    // First try to eliminate any common units
173    if (unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
174        && multiplier.baseUnit().equals(ratio.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
175      // Per<N, D> * D -> yield N
176      // Case 1: denominator of the Per cancels out, return with just the units of the numerator
177      return ratio.numerator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
178    } else if (multiplier.baseUnit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
179        && baseUnit().equals(ratio.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
180      // D * Per<N, D) -> yield N
181      // Case 2: Same as Case 1, just flipped between this and the multiplier
182      return ratio.numerator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
183    } else if (unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> per
184        && multiplier.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> otherPer
185        && per.denominator().getBaseUnit().equals(otherPer.numerator().getBaseUnit())
186        && per.numerator().getBaseUnit().equals(otherPer.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
187      // multiplying eg meters per second * milliseconds per foot
188      // return a scalar
189      return Value.of(baseUnitResult);
190    }
191
192    // No common units to eliminate, is one of them dimensionless?
193    // Note that this must come *after* the multiplier cases, otherwise
194    // Per<U, Dimensionless> * Dimensionless will not return a U
195    if (multiplier.unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
196      // scalar multiplication of this
197      return times(multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
198    } else if (unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
199      // scalar multiplication of multiplier
200      return multiplier.times(baseUnitMagnitude());
201    }
202
203    if (multiplier instanceof Acceleration<?> acceleration) {
204      return times(acceleration);
205    } else if (multiplier instanceof Angle angle) {
206      return times(angle);
207    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularAcceleration angularAcceleration) {
208      return times(angularAcceleration);
209    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularMomentum angularMomentum) {
210      return times(angularMomentum);
211    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularVelocity angularVelocity) {
212      return times(angularVelocity);
213    } else if (multiplier instanceof Current current) {
214      return times(current);
215    } else if (multiplier instanceof Dimensionless dimensionless) {
216      // n.b. this case should already be covered
217      return times(dimensionless);
218    } else if (multiplier instanceof Distance distance) {
219      return times(distance);
220    } else if (multiplier instanceof Energy energy) {
221      return times(energy);
222    } else if (multiplier instanceof Force force) {
223      return times(force);
224    } else if (multiplier instanceof Frequency frequency) {
225      return times(frequency);
226    } else if (multiplier instanceof LinearAcceleration linearAcceleration) {
227      return times(linearAcceleration);
228    } else if (multiplier instanceof LinearVelocity linearVelocity) {
229      return times(linearVelocity);
230    } else if (multiplier instanceof Mass mass) {
231      return times(mass);
232    } else if (multiplier instanceof MomentOfInertia momentOfInertia) {
233      return times(momentOfInertia);
234    } else if (multiplier instanceof Mult<?, ?> mult) {
235      return times(mult);
236    } else if (multiplier instanceof Per<?, ?> per) {
237      return times(per);
238    } else if (multiplier instanceof Power power) {
239      return times(power);
240    } else if (multiplier instanceof Temperature temperature) {
241      return times(temperature);
242    } else if (multiplier instanceof Time time) {
243      return times(time);
244    } else if (multiplier instanceof Torque torque) {
245      return times(torque);
246    } else if (multiplier instanceof Velocity<?> velocity) {
247      return times(velocity);
248    } else if (multiplier instanceof Voltage voltage) {
249      return times(voltage);
250    } else if (multiplier instanceof Resistance resistance) {
251      return times(resistance);
252    } else {
253      // Dimensional analysis fallthrough or a generic input measure type
254      // Do a basic unit multiplication
255      return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit()).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
256    }
257  }
258
259  /**
260   * Multiplies this measure by an acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the most
261   * appropriate unit.
262   *
263   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
264   * @return the multiplication result
265   */
266  default Measure<?> times(Acceleration<?> multiplier) {
267    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
268        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
269  }
270
271  /**
272   * Multiplies this measure by an angle and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
273   * unit.
274   *
275   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
276   * @return the multiplication result
277   */
278  default Measure<?> times(Angle multiplier) {
279    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
280        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Multiplies this measure by an angular acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the
285   * most appropriate unit.
286   *
287   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
288   * @return the multiplication result
289   */
290  default Measure<?> times(AngularAcceleration multiplier) {
291    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
292        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
293  }
294
295  /**
296   * Multiplies this measure by an angular momentum and returns the resulting measure in the most
297   * appropriate unit.
298   *
299   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
300   * @return the multiplication result
301   */
302  default Measure<?> times(AngularMomentum multiplier) {
303    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
304        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
305  }
306
307  /**
308   * Multiplies this measure by an angular velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
309   * appropriate unit.
310   *
311   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
312   * @return the multiplication result
313   */
314  default Measure<?> times(AngularVelocity multiplier) {
315    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
316        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
317  }
318
319  /**
320   * Multiplies this measure by an electric current and returns the resulting measure in the most
321   * appropriate unit.
322   *
323   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
324   * @return the multiplication result
325   */
326  default Measure<?> times(Current multiplier) {
327    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
328        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
329  }
330
331  /**
332   * Multiplies this measure by a distance and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
333   * unit.
334   *
335   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
336   * @return the multiplication result
337   */
338  default Measure<?> times(Distance multiplier) {
339    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
340        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
341  }
342
343  /**
344   * Multiplies this measure by an energy and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
345   * unit.
346   *
347   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
348   * @return the multiplication result
349   */
350  default Measure<?> times(Energy multiplier) {
351    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
352        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
353  }
354
355  /**
356   * Multiplies this measure by a force and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
357   * unit.
358   *
359   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
360   * @return the multiplication result
361   */
362  default Measure<?> times(Force multiplier) {
363    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
364        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * Multiplies this measure by a frequency and returns the resulting measure in the most
369   * appropriate unit. This often - but not always - means implementations return a variation of a
370   * {@link Per} measure.
371   *
372   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
373   * @return the multiplication result
374   */
375  default Measure<?> times(Frequency multiplier) {
376    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
377        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Multiplies this measure by a linear acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the most
382   * appropriate unit.
383   *
384   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
385   * @return the multiplication result
386   */
387  default Measure<?> times(LinearAcceleration multiplier) {
388    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
389        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
390  }
391
392  /**
393   * Multiplies this measure by a linear momentum and returns the resulting measure in the most
394   * appropriate unit.
395   *
396   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
397   * @return the multiplication result
398   */
399  default Measure<?> times(LinearMomentum multiplier) {
400    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
401        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
402  }
403
404  /**
405   * Multiplies this measure by a linear velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
406   * appropriate unit.
407   *
408   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
409   * @return the multiplication result
410   */
411  default Measure<?> times(LinearVelocity multiplier) {
412    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
413        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
414  }
415
416  /**
417   * Multiplies this measure by a mass and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
418   * unit.
419   *
420   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
421   * @return the multiplication result
422   */
423  default Measure<?> times(Mass multiplier) {
424    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
425        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
426  }
427
428  /**
429   * Multiplies this measure by a moment of intertia and returns the resulting measure in the most
430   * appropriate unit.
431   *
432   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
433   * @return the multiplication result
434   */
435  default Measure<?> times(MomentOfInertia multiplier) {
436    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
437        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
438  }
439
440  /**
441   * Multiplies this measure by a generic multiplied measure and returns the resulting measure in
442   * the most appropriate unit.
443   *
444   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
445   * @return the multiplication result
446   */
447  default Measure<?> times(Mult<?, ?> multiplier) {
448    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
449        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
450  }
451
452  /**
453   * Multiplies this measure by a power and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
454   * unit.
455   *
456   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
457   * @return the multiplication result
458   */
459  default Measure<?> times(Power multiplier) {
460    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
461        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
462  }
463
464  /**
465   * Multiplies this measure by a generic ratio measurement and returns the resulting measure in the
466   * most appropriate unit.
467   *
468   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
469   * @return the multiplication result
470   */
471  default Measure<?> times(Per<?, ?> multiplier) {
472    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
473        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
474  }
475
476  /**
477   * Multiplies this measure by a temperature and returns the resulting measure in the most
478   * appropriate unit.
479   *
480   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
481   * @return the multiplication result
482   */
483  default Measure<?> times(Temperature multiplier) {
484    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
485        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
486  }
487
488  /**
489   * Multiplies this measure by a time and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
490   * unit.
491   *
492   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
493   * @return the multiplication result
494   */
495  default Measure<?> times(Time multiplier) {
496    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
497        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
498  }
499
500  /**
501   * Multiplies this measure by a torque and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
502   * unit.
503   *
504   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.

507  default Measure<?> times(Torque multiplier) {
508    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
509        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
510  }
511
512  /**
513   * Multiplies this measure by a generic velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
514   * appropriate unit.
515   *
516   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
517   * @return the multiplication result
518   */
519  default Measure<?> times(Velocity<?> multiplier) {
520    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
521        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
522  }
523
524  /**
525   * Multiplies this measure by a voltage and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
526   * unit.
527   *
528   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
529   * @return the multiplication result
530   */
531  default Measure<?> times(Voltage multiplier) {
532    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
533        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
534  }
535
536  /**
537   * Multiplies this measure by a resistance and returns the resulting measure in the most
538   * appropriate unit.
539   *
540   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
541   * @return the multiplication result
542   */
543  default Measure<?> times(Resistance multiplier) {
544    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
545        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
546  }
547
548  /**
549   * Multiplies this measure by a conversion factor, returning the converted measurement. Unlike
550   * {@link #times(Per)}, this allows for basic unit cancellation to return measurements of a known
551   * dimension.
552   *
553   * @param conversionFactor the conversion factor by which to multiply
554   * @param <Other> the unit type to convert to
555   * @param <M> the concrete return unit type. <strong>Note: the conversion factor's numerator unit
556   *     must return instances of this type from {@link Unit#ofBaseUnits(double)}}</strong>
557   * @return the converted result
558   */
559  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
560  default <Other extends Unit, M extends Measure<Other>> M timesConversionFactor(
561      Measure<? extends PerUnit<Other, U>> conversionFactor) {
562    return (M)
563        conversionFactor
564            .unit()
565            .getBaseUnit()
566            .numerator()
567            .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * conversionFactor.baseUnitMagnitude());
568  }
569
570  /**
571   * Multiplies this measure by another measurement of the inverse unit type (eg Time multiplied by
572   * Frequency) and returns the resulting dimensionless measure.
573   *
574   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
575   * @return the multiplication result
576   */
577  default Dimensionless timesInverse(
578      Measure<? extends PerUnit<DimensionlessUnit, ? extends U>> multiplier) {
579    return Value.ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
580  }
581
582  /**
583   * Multiplies this measure by another measurement of something over the unit type (eg Time
584   * multiplied by LinearVelocity) and returns the resulting measure of the ratio's dividend unit.
585   *
586   * @param ratio the measurement to multiply by.
587   * @param <Other> other unit that the results are in terms of
588   * @return the multiplication result
589   */
590  default <Other extends Unit> Measure<Other> timesRatio(
591      Measure<? extends PerUnit<? extends Other, U>> ratio) {
592    return ImmutableMeasure.ofBaseUnits(
593        baseUnitMagnitude() * ratio.baseUnitMagnitude(), ratio.unit().numerator());
594  }
595
596  /**
597   * Divides this measure by a unitless scalar and returns the result.
598   *
599   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
600   * @return the division result
601   */
602  Measure<U> divide(double divisor);
603
604  /**
605   * Divides this measure by a dimensionless scalar and returns the result.
606   *
607   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
608   * @return the division result
609   */
610  Measure<U> divide(Dimensionless divisor);
611
612  /**
613   * Divides this measurement by another measure and performs some dimensional analysis to reduce
614   * the units.
615   *
616   * @param divisor the unit to divide by
617   * @return the resulting measure
618   */
619  default Measure<?> divide(Measure<?> divisor) {
620    final double baseUnitResult = baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude();
621
622    if (unit().getBaseUnit().equals(divisor.unit().getBaseUnit())) {
623      // These are the same unit, return a dimensionless
624      return Value.ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
625    }
626
627    if (divisor instanceof Dimensionless) {
628      // Dividing by a dimensionless, do a scalar division
629      return unit().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
630    }
631
632    if (unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
633      // Numerator is a dimensionless
634      if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio) {
635        // Dividing by a ratio, return its reciprocal scaled by this
636        return ratio.reciprocal().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
637      }
638      if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio) {
639        // Dividing by a Per<Time, U>, return its reciprocal velocity scaled by this
640        // Note: Per<Time, U>.reciprocal() is coded to return a Velocity<U>
641        return ratio.reciprocal().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
642      }
643    }
644
645    if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
646        && ratio.numerator().getBaseUnit().equals(baseUnit())) {
647      // Numerator of the ratio cancels out
648      // N / (N / D) -> N * D / N -> D
649      // Note: all Velocity and Acceleration units inherit from PerUnit
650      return ratio.denominator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
651    }
652
653    if (divisor.unit() instanceof TimeUnit time) {
654      // Dividing by a time, return a Velocity
655      return VelocityUnit.combine(unit(), time).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
656    }
657
658    if (divisor instanceof Acceleration<?> acceleration) {
659      return divide(acceleration);
660    } else if (divisor instanceof Angle angle) {
661      return divide(angle);
662    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularAcceleration angularAcceleration) {
663      return divide(angularAcceleration);
664    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularMomentum angularMomentum) {
665      return divide(angularMomentum);
666    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularVelocity angularVelocity) {
667      return divide(angularVelocity);
668    } else if (divisor instanceof Current current) {
669      return divide(current);
670    } else if (divisor instanceof Dimensionless dimensionless) {
671      // n.b. this case should already be covered
672      return divide(dimensionless);
673    } else if (divisor instanceof Distance distance) {
674      return divide(distance);
675    } else if (divisor instanceof Energy energy) {
676      return divide(energy);
677    } else if (divisor instanceof Force force) {
678      return divide(force);
679    } else if (divisor instanceof Frequency frequency) {
680      return divide(frequency);
681    } else if (divisor instanceof LinearAcceleration linearAcceleration) {
682      return divide(linearAcceleration);
683    } else if (divisor instanceof LinearVelocity linearVelocity) {
684      return divide(linearVelocity);
685    } else if (divisor instanceof Mass mass) {
686      return divide(mass);
687    } else if (divisor instanceof MomentOfInertia momentOfInertia) {
688      return divide(momentOfInertia);
689    } else if (divisor instanceof Mult<?, ?> mult) {
690      return divide(mult);
691    } else if (divisor instanceof Per<?, ?> per) {
692      return divide(per);
693    } else if (divisor instanceof Power power) {
694      return divide(power);
695    } else if (divisor instanceof Temperature temperature) {
696      return divide(temperature);
697    } else if (divisor instanceof Time time) {
698      return divide(time);
699    } else if (divisor instanceof Torque torque) {
700      return divide(torque);
701    } else if (divisor instanceof Velocity<?> velocity) {
702      return divide(velocity);
703    } else if (divisor instanceof Voltage voltage) {
704      return divide(voltage);
705    } else if (divisor instanceof Resistance resistance) {
706      return divide(resistance);
707    } else {
708      // Dimensional analysis fallthrough or a generic input measure type
709      // Do a basic unit multiplication
710      return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit()).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
711    }
712  }
713
714  /**
715   * Divides this measure by a generic acceleration and returns the result in the most appropriate
716   * unit.
717   *
718   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
719   * @return the division result
720   */
721  default Measure<?> divide(Acceleration<?> divisor) {
722    return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
723        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());
724  }

732  default Measure<?> divide(Angle divisor) {
733    return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
734        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());
735  }

931  /**

935   *
936   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
937   * @return the division result
938   */
939  default Measure<?> divide(Time divisor) {
940    return VelocityUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
941        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());

987
988  /**
989   * Divides this measure by a ratio in terms of this measurement's unit to another unit, returning
990   * a measurement in terms of the other unit.
991   *
992   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
993   * @param <Other> the other unit that results are in terms of
994   * @return the division result
995   */
996  // eg Dimensionless / (Dimensionless / Time) -> Time
997  default <Other extends Unit> Measure<Other> divideRatio(
998      Measure<? extends PerUnit<? extends U, Other>> divisor) {
999    return ImmutableMeasure.ofBaseUnits(
1000        baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude(), divisor.unit().denominator());
1001  }
1002
1003  /**
1004   * Divides this measure by a time period and returns the result in the most appropriate unit. This
1005   * is equivalent to {@code divide(period.of(1))}.
1006   *
1007   * @param period the time period measurement to divide by.
1008   * @return the division result
1009   */
1010  default Measure<?> per(TimeUnit period) {
1011    return divide(period.of(1));
1012  }
1013
1014  /**
1015   * Checks if this measure is near another measure of the same unit. Provide a variance threshold
1016   * for use for a +/- scalar, such as 0.05 for +/- 5%.
1017   *
1018   * <pre>
1019   *   Inches.of(11).isNear(Inches.of(10), 0.1) // true
1020   *   Inches.of(12).isNear(Inches.of(10), 0.1) // false
1021   * </pre>
1022   *
1023   * @param other the other measurement to compare against
1024   * @param varianceThreshold the acceptable variance threshold, in terms of an acceptable +/- error
1025   *     range multiplier. Checking if a value is within 10% means a value of 0.1 should be passed;
1026   *     checking if a value is within 1% means a value of 0.01 should be passed, and so on.
1027   * @return true if this unit is near the other measure, otherwise false
1028   */
1029  default boolean isNear(Measure<?> other, double varianceThreshold) {
1030    if (!this.unit().getBaseUnit().equivalent(other.unit().getBaseUnit())) {
1031      return false; // Disjoint units, not compatible
1032    }
1033
1034    // abs so negative inputs are calculated correctly
1035    var tolerance = Math.abs(other.baseUnitMagnitude() * varianceThreshold);
1036
1037    return Math.abs(this.baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude()) <= tolerance;
1038  }
1039
1040  /**
1041   * Checks if this measure is near another measure of the same unit, with a specified tolerance of
1042   * the same unit.
1043   *
1044   * <pre>
1045   *     Meters.of(1).isNear(Meters.of(1.2), Millimeters.of(300)) // true
1046   *     Degrees.of(90).isNear(Rotations.of(0.5), Degrees.of(45)) // false
1047   * </pre>
1048   *
1049   * @param other the other measure to compare against.
1050   * @param tolerance the tolerance allowed in which the two measures are defined as near each
1051   *     other.
1052   * @return true if this unit is near the other measure, otherwise false.
1053   */
1054  default boolean isNear(Measure<U> other, Measure<U> tolerance) {
1055    return Math.abs(this.baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude())
1056        <= Math.abs(tolerance.baseUnitMagnitude());
1057  }
1058
1059  /**
1060   * Checks if this measure is equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1061   *
1062   * @param other the measure to compare to
1063   * @return true if this measure is equivalent, false otherwise
1064   */
1065  default boolean isEquivalent(Measure<?> other) {
1066    // Return false for disjoint units that aren't compatible
1067    return this.unit().getBaseUnit().equals(other.unit().getBaseUnit())
1068        && Math.abs(baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude()) <= EQUIVALENCE_THRESHOLD;
1069  }
1070
1071  /** {@inheritDoc} */
1072  @Override
1073  default int compareTo(Measure<U> o) {
1074    return Double.compare(this.baseUnitMagnitude(), o.baseUnitMagnitude());
1075  }
1076
1077  /**
1078   * Checks if this measure is greater than another measure of the same unit.
1079   *
1080   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1081   * @return true if this measure has a greater equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1082   */
1083  default boolean gt(Measure<U> o) {
1084    return compareTo(o) > 0;
1085  }
1086
1087  /**
1088   * Checks if this measure is greater than or equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1089   *
1090   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1091   * @return true if this measure has an equal or greater equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1092   */
1093  default boolean gte(Measure<U> o) {
1094    return compareTo(o) > 0 || isEquivalent(o);
1095  }
1096
1097  /**
1098   * Checks if this measure is less than another measure of the same unit.
1099   *
1100   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1101   * @return true if this measure has a lesser equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1102   */
1103  default boolean lt(Measure<U> o) {
1104    return compareTo(o) < 0;
1105  }
1106
1107  /**
1108   * Checks if this measure is less than or equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1109   *
1110   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1111   * @return true if this measure has an equal or lesser equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1112   */
1113  default boolean lte(Measure<U> o) {
1114    return compareTo(o) < 0 || isEquivalent(o);
1115  }
1116
1117  /**
1118   * Returns the measure with the absolute value closest to positive infinity.
1119   *
1120   * @param <U> the type of the units of the measures
1121   * @param measures the set of measures to compare
1122   * @return the measure with the greatest positive magnitude, or null if no measures were provided
1123   */
1124  @SafeVarargs
1125  static <U extends Unit> Measure<U> max(Measure<U>... measures) {
1126    if (measures.length == 0) {
1127      return null; // nothing to compare
1128    }
1129
1130    Measure<U> max = null;
1131    for (Measure<U> measure : measures) {
1132      if (max == null || measure.gt(max)) {
1133        max = measure;
1134      }
1135    }
1136
1137    return max;
1138  }
1139
1140  /**
1141   * Returns the measure with the absolute value closest to negative infinity.
1142   *
1143   * @param <U> the type of the units of the measures
1144   * @param measures the set of measures to compare
1145   * @return the measure with the greatest negative magnitude
1146   */
1147  @SafeVarargs
1148  static <U extends Unit> Measure<U> min(Measure<U>... measures) {
1149    if (measures.length == 0) {
1150      return null; // nothing to compare
1151    }
1152
1153    Measure<U> max = null;
1154    for (Measure<U> measure : measures) {
1155      if (max == null || measure.lt(max)) {
1156        max = measure;
1157      }
1158    }
1159
1160    return max;
1161  }
1162
1163  /**
1164   * Returns a string representation of this measurement in a shorthand form. The symbol of the
1165   * backing unit is used, rather than the full name, and the magnitude is represented in scientific
1166   * notation.
1167   *
1168   * @return the short form representation of this measurement
1169   */
1170  default String toShortString() {
1171    // eg 1.234e+04 V/m (1234 Volt per Meter in long form)
1172    return String.format("%.3e %s", magnitude(), unit().symbol());
1173  }
1174
1175  /**
1176   * Returns a string representation of this measurement in a longhand form. The name of the backing
1177   * unit is used, rather than its symbol, and the magnitude is represented in a full string, not
1178   * scientific notation. (Very large values may be represented in scientific notation, however)
1179   *
1180   * @return the long form representation of this measurement
1181   */
1182  default String toLongString() {
1183    // eg 1234 Volt per Meter (1.234e+04 V/m in short form)
1184    return String.format("%s %s", magnitude(), unit().name());
1185  }
1186}
